categories.title: Core Concepts
categories.description: Foundational terms that describe how experience organizes.

categories.title: Modes of Living
categories.description: Ways experience and action function as coherence changes.

entries.title: Automatic Self
entries.summary: Learned patterns that run perception, emotion, and behavior automatically.

entries.title: Baseline
entries.summary: The default level of functioning the system returns to between events.

entries.title: Coherence
entries.summary: The degree to which internal processes operate in coordination rather than conflict.

entries.title: Conscious Self
entries.summary: The capacity for deliberate attention, reflection, and intentional choice.

entries.title: Effort
entries.summary: The felt application of conscious energy to influence attention, behavior, or internal state.

entries.title: False Presence
entries.summary: Attention that appears stable while underlying tension or effort remains.

entries.title: Field Coherence
entries.summary: The degree of alignment and stability within the field of experience.

entries.title: Field of Experience
entries.summary: The total moment-to-moment context in which perception, sensation, emotion, and thought arise.

entries.title: Identity Dissolution
entries.summary: A loosening of identification with habitual self-references, roles, and narratives.

entries.title: Interference
entries.summary: Internal activity that disrupts coordination within the field of experience.

entries.title: Interoception
entries.summary: The capacity to sense and interpret signals originating from within the body.

entries.title: Original Intelligence (OI)
entries.summary: Innate, non-narrative intelligence revealed as interference settles.

entries.title: Physiological Settling
entries.summary: The bodyâ€™s return toward balance as activation, tension, and internal load reduce.

entries.title: Presence
entries.summary: Attentive availability to immediate experience as it unfolds.

entries.title: Presence vs Coherence
entries.summary: A clarification of the difference between attentional availability (presence) and internal alignment (coherence).

entries.title: Regulation
entries.summary: The capacity to modulate internal state and recover smoothly as conditions change.

entries.title: Still Point
entries.summary: A moment or period where internal activity settles to a minimum and urgency drops out.

entries.title: Unselfconscious Motion
entries.summary: Action that unfolds without excessive self-monitoring or internal interference.

entries.title: Wave Learning
entries.summary: Non-linear development in cycles of settling, disruption, integration, and re-stabilization.

entries.title: Zero Field
entries.summary: A condition of minimal interference within the field of experience.

entries.title: Field of Experience
entries.summary: The total, moment-to-moment field in which sensations, thoughts, emotions, and actions arise.

entries.title: Identity Dissolution
entries.summary: A loosening or dropping of rigid self-identity as experience organizes with less narrative reference.

entries.title: Interoception
entries.summary: The capacity to sense internal bodily signals such as breath, heartbeat, tension, and visceral states.
